sn45.6:1.2: Then a mendicant went up to the Buddha … and asked him,
sn45.6:1.3: “Sir, they speak of this thing called the ‘spiritual path’.
sn45.6:1.4: What is the spiritual path? And what is the culmination of the spiritual path?”
sn45.6:2.1: “Mendicant, the spiritual path is simply this noble eightfold path, that is:
sn45.6:2.2: right view, right thought, right speech, right action, right livelihood, right effort, right mindfulness, and right immersion.
sn45.6:2.3: The ending of greed, hate, and delusion.
sn45.6:2.4: This is the culmination of the spiritual path.”
